metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6640 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The prctl_set_vma_anon_name function in kernel/sys.c in Android before 5.1.1 LMY49F and 6.0 before 2016-01-01 does not ensure that only one vma is accessed in a certain update action, which allows attackers to gain privileges or cause a denial of service (vma list corruption) via a crafted application, aka internal bug 20017123.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6640` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> android kernel specific jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support sbeattie> prctl_update_vma_anon_name() is an android kernel only function
